decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) . | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The extension permitted shall only be occupied for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the existing dwelling, 33 Craneswater Park, and not for any separate residential use or any other use (including industrial, commercial or business use).  REASON:	To ensure that the use of the garage does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
description: Two storey side and single storey rear extensions
